unnormalised: Delhi HC grants interim injunction in favor of Super Cassettes Industries (T-Series) in copyright infringement suit. T-Series, represented by Adv. Rajiv Nayar, filed a suit against Shri Durga Entertainment for allegedly infringing copyright of several Bollywood songs and movies.
normalised: Delhi High Court grants interim injunction in favour of Super Cassettes Industries (T-Series) in copyright infringement suit. T-Series, represented by Advocate Rajiv Nayar, filed a suit against Shri Durga Entertainment for allegedly infringing copyright of several Bollywood songs and movies.

unnormalised: The court observed that prima facie, a case of infringement was made out. Justice Pratibha M. Singh issued an order restraining Shri Durga Entertainment from broadcasting, communicating to the public, or otherwise exploiting the copyrighted works of T-Series. The list includes hit tracks from films like "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" & "Kuch Kuch Hota Hai," among others.
normalised: The court observed that prima facie, a case of infringement was made out. Justice Pratibha M. Singh issued an order restraining Shri Durga Entertainment from broadcasting, communicating to the public, or otherwise exploiting the copyrighted works of T-Series. The list includes hit tracks from films like "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" and "Kuch Kuch Hota Hai," among others.

unnormalised: T-Series alleged that Shri Durga Entertainment was running an unauthorized broadcasting service and exploiting their copyrighted content without permission. The label claimed substantial losses due to this infringement. They sought a permanent injunction and damages amounting to Rs 2 crore.
normalised: T-Series alleged that Shri Durga Entertainment was running an unauthorized broadcasting service and exploiting their copyrighted content without permission. The label claimed substantial losses due to this infringement. They sought a permanent injunction and damages amounting to rupees two crore.

unnormalised: The next hearing is scheduled for 15/11/2024. This move is seen as a strong message against piracy & copyright violations in the Indian entertainment industry. Cases like these involving copyright law and IP are crucial.
normalised: The next hearing is scheduled for fifteenth november two thousand and twenty four. This move is seen as a strong message against piracy and copyright violations in the Indian entertainment industry. Cases like these involving copyright law and I-P are crucial.

unnormalised: This is not the first time T-Series has taken legal action to protect its intellectual property. They actively monitor & pursue legal remedies against infringers. Previously, the label won a similar case against a cable operator in UP, resulting in a hefty fine of â‚¹50 lakhs.
normalised: This is not the first time T-Series has taken legal action to protect its intellectual property. They actively monitor and pursue legal remedies against infringers. Previously, the label won a similar case against a cable operator in U-P, resulting in a hefty fine of rupee fifty lakhs.
